website_summaries.verdict: Variable shade that covers common welding needs. Includes 4 sensors to determine shade.
pros: Primary shade adjustment from 9 through 13, as well as 5 through 9 in some modes
Viewing area measures 3.86 inches by 1.73 inches, which ranks ahead of most helmets in this price range
Versatile helmet will work on grinding, cutting and welding work
Includes knob to adjust sensitivity quickly and easily
cons: May not fit well for some people
Sometimes will not darken quickly enough

customer_reviews.title: Great budget helmet
customer_reviews.text: Great budget helmet, really happy with it. Bought it as a loaner but have found myself using it a lot. Very crisp, haven't gotten flashed at all. Not sure about the review claiming they received burned corneas due to the helmet not triggering. Auto darkening helmets block 100% of the UV and IR light, even when off. Edit 11/20/17: Going to add that the brightness on this helmet is variable. Here's a tip: If you see a floating spot after welding, GO DARKER.
customer_reviews.author: Diesel JonesTop Contributor: Welding

customer_reviews.title: High quality for a low price with a host of features!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this helmet for around 10 months now almost daily and I have no complaints at all. You just can't beat the price and quality you get for the price. It came with multiple replacement lenses and it hosts a bunch of settings to match what you are doing. I love the ability to choose what shade I want with the simple flip of a switch. From grinding to welding reflective metals like aluminum or stainless steel... this helmet will protect your eyes and do it well. Probably gonna buy another one soon so I have a backup because I simply don't know what I'd do without it!
customer_reviews.author: Eek

customer_reviews.title: Does not inspire confidence.
customer_reviews.text: The helmet does not inspire confidence. It seems to work (for now) but the battery check light does not function as per the instructions, the batteries check good on a independent tester. I understand it also has solar power but if the batteries were not important they would not have been included. Some may see this as a minor issue but without a functioning battery check you really cannot do a proper safety check. Also, the malfunctioning battery check is indicative of generally poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, period.
customer_reviews.text: First hood. Works awesome! I have bros with $400+ hoods who are impressed with the performance and features of this helmet. Bought the black one and put my own snazzy lil paint job on there.
customer_reviews.author: Tre

customer_reviews.title: This is a follow up to giving helmit a 5 star rating
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 5 star rating but after a few uses I started to get Arc burn to my eyes at first I was happy with the helmet but after getting full flash while laying down a bead I thew it in the Trash Can Save money and loose your Eye sight not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Deep water

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with my price and performance.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a brand new welder so honestly I'm not in a position to compare equipment. This is my first helmet. So far I've used it once and it works great. The autodarkening works perfectly and for using a gasless flux welder the tint was perfect as well. The helmet itself is not made of metal but of vinyl plastic that is very tough but is flexible, this also makes it very light weight. The adjustable strap and headband worked well to adjust to my head and the helmet stays up once you adjust the knobs to the right tightness. Overall I couldn't be happier with my price and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny L Nipp

customer_reviews.title: My poor eyes
customer_reviews.text: Flashed my eyes twice wearing this helmet. After a trip to the hospital and antibiotics I have invested in a better helmet. The cheap cost of this helmet is not worth it compared to my vision.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, screws broke off quick.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this helmet for my son for wielding school to use few times a week while learning. It lasted 5 weeks. The screws on both sides broke off. I called Amazon for help locating replacement parts. Amazon tried to contact the manufacturers with no luck, so they refunded me 20% of the purchase price. I am disappointed with the quality of this helmet and I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lina Laverty

customer_reviews.title: Sparks kept getting in the helmet
customer_reviews.text: This mabe just what happened to me but no matter how much I made adjustments everytime I breathed the inner lens would fog up but what really bothered me was that sparks from welding somehow kept getting into the helmet itself and almost burned my face. Extremely dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler James Heymann

customer_reviews.title: Afordable mask that took heavy use and abuse.
customer_reviews.text: I spent a month welding every day for 7 hours a day with this helmet and it did the job for me. I was not gentle on it and it held up to the abuse. I upgraded the front strap with this  and it helped stop the sweat and wore a welding cap/ baseball cap. Has good sized view area. When I first got it I had to loosen the back nut and dropped it loosing one of the small parts inside which was frustrating. I found it on the floor but just be warned when you loosen it too much. I would also get some pull off plastic screens for the front to help save glass.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Cheater lens falls out of helmet to the ground
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with a Harbor Freight helmet. Because of all the high reviews decided to try this hemet.All in All this is an OK helmet. The problem is the helmet's design to hold cheaters. My glass cheaters fit perfect in the HF helmet. After falling to the ground twice I duck taped my scratched cheaters to the inside. Not liking the duck tape mess I ordered the Antra Cheaters from Amazon. They did not fit very well either because of the helmet design.The lens are plastic so I returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mabalis Eddie

customer_reviews.title: It’s like buying a broken helmet.
customer_reviews.text: Caution: DO NOT BUY. I am in a welding class. I don’t even weld for that long. I bought this because it was on top 10 best welding helmets. It Worked great for 2 classes and then broke permanently. Tried replacing batteries and doing everything I could to replace it, but it is permanently broken
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Cromack

customer_reviews.title: The helmet overall is not terrible, a bit flimsy though
customer_reviews.text: The helmet overall is not terrible, a bit flimsy though. The lens is OK. However, the absolutely infuriating thing about this helmet is it won't stay up! The helmet always creeps down, and drives me crazy. It won't snap in an up position. If you crank up the tightness of the pivots to get the helmet to stay up, it's too tight, and won't come down. If they're lose enough the slide the helmet down, the helmet simply creeps down on its​ own. Summary: an OK helmet completely and totally ruined by saving a fraction of a penny on a horribly cheap poorly designed pivot.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Somogyi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Working Hood for an Amazing Price
customer_reviews.text: Grind mode, static shade 4 filter for flame cutting, shades 5-13. This is a great buy and the filter responds great (better than my $110 Miller classic series). I was skeptical as it’s made in china and cheap, but since the product works fully as intended I am a very happy customer on this one. The knob to adjust shade/grind mode will actually click when it goes into grind mode, so you don’t have to remove OR flip the helmet up to make the change and its efficient. Little details like that make the welding experience much smoother. 6/5 stars because of the incredible price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not usable, cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to use in my welding class, A total waste of my hard earned money.
customer_reviews.author: David P.-Osonoi

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive helmet
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Inexpensive. Comfortable and lightweight. Auto darkening is fast and works well. Adjusts easily. Works for MIG/TIG, stick and grinding (Harbor Freight standard helmet for the same price supposedly doesn't work for MIG/TIG) I was glad to get the extra lenses along with the helmet. Exterior lens easy to replace. CONS: Not suitable for overhead welding and the owners manual says as much, the exterior setting dial tends to drift, the interior lens is difficult to replace. For the money, this helmet is great. I will probably buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: jp4

customer_reviews.title: Can't trust it
customer_reviews.text: Granted I bought this hood 6 years ago, I finally got to use it for the first day of class. At first I thought it was pretty good. The knob on the outside is a bad idea, you accidently touch it and it changes. I went to weld overhead and after a few times it quite detecting the arc, or would take a few seconds to switch. Can't risk my eyes, bought a name brand. The protective lens is pretty flimsy so maybe that had something to do with it. Hope they worked out the bugs by now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: So far I really like it!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! Reacts to welding instantly! Be warned it also reacts to bright sunlight too especially reflecting off bright surfaces such as my welding table.. So far I really like it! Update: I have used this welding helmet for a while now and it does work excellent.. Recently when I went to use it the lens was flashing and then did not auto-darken.. This was caused by worn out batteries.. Changed the batteries which I ordered from here when I bought the helmet and I was back in business! Thinking that placing the helmet in grind mode when not in use will extend battery life so I am trying to remember to do this when in storage..
customer_reviews.author: RayBo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty techy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Headgear assembly was a minor PITA but it functions nicely once the features and adjustments are figured out. The sensors are very sensitive to ambient light to the extent that if you're working outdoors in bright sun it makes a go/no go difference whether you're facing into the sunlight or away- not particularly a plus in my case but then I'm an old school low tech kind of guy brushing up on my stick skills after 30+ so some difficulties are to be expected aren't they? ; )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was my first welding helmet, I have not tried many helmets. I am a beginner welder and have only used one or two others that were old. So this helmet did not have much to compete with. But it blows away my expectations. It includes, well i don't even know how many, probably 5 front plastic shields. Has a button to test and makes sure it works. And works great no matter what you are welding in whatever enironment you are in. I adjust depending on the piece I am working on and I don't even think about if it works or not, it just does.
customer_reviews.author: Va

customer_reviews.title: Works great and my welding has improved!
customer_reviews.text: Although auto-darkening helmets have been out for years, I had always put off buying one due to price. So when I saw the price of this helmet wouldn't break my budget I thought I'd give it a shot. I read the manual then chose middle-of-the-road settings yet I was still a bit hesitant to try it... so I just looked toward the sun and when I saw how quickly it darkened, I was ready to go. And to say the least, I was very pleasantly surprised how well it worked, and further, how much my welding improved.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Reliable TIG helmet that can’t be beat for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a weekend warrior welder at best, and have been attempting to learn TIG over the past year. My previous auto-darken helmet just didn’t cut it, and wasn’t sensitive enough to reliably trigger on the TIG arc, causing frequent flashes that really made a challenging craft near impossible. So far I’ve had about 5 hours under this hood, and have put it through low amperage DC, AC, and pulse without a single issue. It triggers every time, even at 2 amp starts, and doesn’t seem to mind my LED shop lights that really messed with my last helmet. Time will tell how it holds up, but I can’t imagine finding a better TIG helmet for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Dillahunty

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BEGINNER INVESTMENT!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this helmet almost a month now. I'm a student of Tulsa welding school. I wanted this helmet for my first out of pocket cost welding helmet just by the design alone, however, thd quality is out of this world. I assuming when I say, since Idk much about welding or equipment just yet, this is a GREAT beginner helmet, and it wont break the bank. This is coming from someone on a fixed income atm. GREAT investment. I love the fact that the darkening/grind option knob is on the left outside. I'm right hand it so it makes it easier to adjust from grinding, the the desired darkness. Boom, set, nod the helmet down, strike that arc!
customer_reviews.author: Graven

customer_reviews.title: Super value
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to buying one of these auto darkening helmets. I learned welding with the old flip up stuff and had always wanted the auto as I was tired of getting "flashed"!!! I rarely weld but for the low price I would give it a go. Only used for far for like 5 mins, but it works great and I don't have to worry about getting "flashed" anymore!! I am sure my eyes will like that as will my long term vision!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Works, for a while anyway
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when I first bought it. It’s been about a year and it’s quit working correctly. As soon as the arc is started, it’ll darken like it’s supposed to, but then randomly shut off and on while it should be staying dark. I even replaced the batteries hoping to remedy the issue. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: naporter

customer_reviews.title: pretty good beginner helmete, from a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: this helmet is pretty good as far as i can tell. I just got into welding and I found this at a great price. it does a great job at transitioning to the dark shade instantly! the adjustable tint is very handy and seems to work well for me so far and plus it comes with extra glass cover so you can replace the one it comes with once it becomes damaged! my only complaint if you can even call it that is that when you flip the helmet up, it slowly slides down, and if i tighten it down any more it wont be able to flip up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a very, very good helmet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a newbie welder and this is my first personally-owned welding helmet. Last time I welded, in a class, 15 years ago, there were no auto-darkening helmets. This technology is fantastic and greatly improves accuracy, speed, & safety of welding. This particular helmet is almost 100% plastic (as opposed to some kind of fiberglass-impregnated resin) and it does not appear very tough. But the auto-darkening works perfectly, the included headband is adjustable & secure, and it comes with a number of replacement cover-plates for the shade glass. Will update this review in future with notes on long-term durability.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Valnonnia

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is good value
customer_reviews.text: I am a occasionally welder... and I did not want to spend the hundreds of $ on a professional level helmet. I tried a Helmet from Walmart that was a joke... the darkening shade did not work, this Antra helmet works every time and the adjustment are right on... if there is a downside it is that is ultralight and tends to sit on one's head too lightly... thus, comes off occasional when you move your head too fast. Otherwise a recommended Helmet
customer_reviews.author: fdoamerica

customer_reviews.title: This helmet eats batteries like a mother and it recently quit working entirely for ...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! This helmet eats batteries like a mother and it recently quit working entirely for me. It blinds the crap out of you before darkening, even with the sensitivity turned all the way up. It worked fine for the first couple years I had it but now it is a safety hazard. I have taken good care of it and never abused or dropped it and have kept it stored in a dry place but it is a pile of crap. Spend the extra money and buy a quality helmet. Don’t be a cheap bastard like me.
customer_reviews.author: Deltoidz

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I took welding classes as the local trade school and purchased two of these helmets. They work well and dim quickly while allowing you to see when dimming isn't needed. I liked that the darkness and response controls were easy to adjust, but found I accidentally adjusted them on occasion. I placed a piece of electrical tape over the controls to avoid this and everything worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Glass clarity is poor. In the grind mode or not darkened everything ...
customer_reviews.text: Antra AH6-2600-0000 is a lousy helmet. Band is uncomfortable, tension adjustment is awkward having to push head band tension knob in before turning. Detent positions for helmet up have inconsistent tension. Partially raise helmet to first position and it falls down with the slightest movement when tension is set properly for fully up position. Glass clarity is poor. In the grind mode or not darkened everything is piss yellow and very dark. I do not recommend this helmet. Update - One year down the road and it no longer darkens (even with fresh batteries). Don't waste your money on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ptah

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet for the price, works well
customer_reviews.text: Needed to buy my girlfriend a helmet, she wants to learn to weld but not sure of her overall commitment and I don’t need another high dollar helmet. This helmet works well and has some nice features, I like the grinding mode. The ability to quickly change the modes from the outside via a big knob works well for folks learning to weld because you can see the settings quickly. Over all very nice helmet for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Weld like a Pro
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet for me, a rookie and hack welder. On my place, I often have tractor, mower, and all other parts break. It is imperative that I be able to weld a bit to keep things going. Stick welding was torture for me with my old "pull down" helmet. It was always a fight between me and the rod. Usually, the rod won. This helmet allows me to see perfectly before striking the arc, and what a difference that makes for a novice welder. Great, great helmet for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Henson

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Value!  Works flawlessy.
customer_reviews.text: I've got to say...I was skeptical when I bought this. When it comes to my eyes, I want them protected when welding and I don't like to take chances. I ordered this based on the reviews I saw on the product and I am glad I did. This mask is very well constructed, comes with extra glass and fits a wide range of head sizes. My favorite parts are the sensitivity adjustment and the way that you tighten the mask on the back of your head. Well constructed and looks like it will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty standard auto-darkening welding helmet
customer_reviews.text: Just be careful with it. When the batteries get low, it might stop darkening when it needs to. You'll be perfectly fine, since the window stops UV light regardless, but you're gonna get some temporary spots in your vision from your welding arc. There's a button inside to test the battery, so definitely use it every time you start welding!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: No more head flipping!
customer_reviews.text: I'm starting up welding again after a few decades. I used to have to flip my head and knock the helmet down and wait for the arc to see what I'm doing. Now the helmet is down and I can see where to start before I weld then it darkens immediately. And for grinding I don't have to life the colored glass. It is very light compared to the old days. Lots of adjustments for how it fits and what type of welding you are doing. I have a bad neck so for me this is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Amy

customer_reviews.title: May work may not
customer_reviews.text: Works great when it works! I've had it for a few months, welded with it on several projects and it was amazing. Now after two battery changes the battery light stays on no matter the troubleshooting (The auto-darkening no longer works) unless you click it to Grind, then the light goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: It came shipped with a cracked filter cartridge, but talking to Amazon and Antra I was able to get a replacement filter cartridge in 3 days. It was easy to replace the cartridge and all the lens pieces. It is very light weight and the auto-darkening is to adjust to what you see fit. The booklet that comes with the mask even has the different variations of welding that can be done and their recommended settings you need for the mask. Overall this is a very well thought out welding mask and it easy to operate even for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Armorer235

customer_reviews.title: Husband likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas, I know nothing about welding helmets so I went with the highest rated one on Amazon at the time. Was a little concerned because he told me it should cost around $100 and this one was waaaaaay less. He loves it and has no idea how little I paid for it. Now he is not a full time welder, just does it for stuff around the house and various projects he works on. I have no idea if that even makes a difference but I wanted to be clear this review is for someone that uses it infrequently.
customer_reviews.author: Beth D.

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second helmet. Nothing was wrong with the first one, just ended up giving it to a friend. I can't really speak for other brands since I'm only a novice welder but I love this thing. Price is great and it works just as good as my other friends Lincoln. Plus, it fits my head. I thought my head was going to be a problem but nope. Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my home projects
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for some grinding, cutting, and welding at home. The grind mode works well so that the helmet doesn't auto darken when you are doing some grinding, but want to protect your face. The reaction time for auto darkening during welding seems to be instantaneous, much faster than I am able to judge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have always been very leery of automatic electronic shades for welding but the old-school hoods are becoming obsolete. My biggest fear is striking off an arc and the electronics fails in the shade. But with so many in use, they must be OK. This hood is very comfortable and easy to setup. The shade covers are removable for cleaning and easy to remove and replace.
customer_reviews.author: PapaJ

customer_reviews.title: Not The Best
customer_reviews.text: It is okay, I get flashed a lot by it because the sensitivity feature doesn't seem to do much. I have it turned all the way up and 3/32" 6013 still takes over a second to bring up the full shielding. Also, the plastic bolt that holds the headband to the helmet fell out on one side and has disappeared from my life, leaving me to replace it with a metal bolt that doesn't do quite as good a job. I cannot leave the shield up anymore because it slams down now, and cut a real nice slice across the bridge of my nose the last time I left it up. Was hoping for something better than this.
customer_reviews.author: AC315

customer_reviews.title: Works great when the batteries are charged
customer_reviews.text: I think this hood really works great for the money, but if the coin batteries in it go dead then the shade darkens too much and you can't see your puddle. If you just turn the darkness down (instead of replacing the batteries) then you'll strain your eyes. Its important to keep spare batteries around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and nothing like safety
customer_reviews.text: I've done my fair share of various welding (far from being a professional), but after my first bout many moons ago in my 20's with flash burn welding in the trunk of a car (business I bought my first one from gave me the wrong lense) having this auto darkening helmet is a cats meow.
customer_reviews.author: Claude

customer_reviews.title: Best Hood I ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: So Happy with this product! Been using regular hoods for so many years (manually drop the hood), Never trusted the photo sensor, but I should have bought one years ago. This one is so easy to turn on and adjust, plus it comes with extra lenses and guards. Welding is so easy now!
customer_reviews.author: makuanel

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I am a diesel mechanic and do a fair amount of mig welding. This helmet came highly reviewed as a low cost high quality option. I agree 100%
customer_reviews.author: G W

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: so far I have done quite a bit of welding with it and it is working out even better than expected. The auto dimming is spot on fast. it is a little sensitive to the lights in my garage (when the hood is flipped up it will auto dim when exposed to the over head lights) but that is not a problem at all for me. So far, so good. and the price was perfect, too. Just as good as the more expensive units
customer_reviews.author: Quickhondaz

customer_reviews.title: Darkens on demand
customer_reviews.text: I'm only the occasional welder but I enjoy this product very much. It darkens whenever I need it to and is lightweight. Another reviewer noted that it's thin skin won't protect you when welding above your head which is probably true but this is why it's so light so that's a compromise I'm willing to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical of this Hood but it's pretty cool. My speed glas hood head band broke ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this Hood but it's pretty cool. My speed glas hood head band broke and it was almost as cheap just to buy this welding hood so I did and wasn't expecting a heck of a lot. That said, it works as good as my speedglas hood with more options. That shade is variable so you can use a torch with one shade, rotate the adjustment knob and go to welding. Also can use it for grinding without darking down much. I'm gonna keep the old one as a backup now.
customer_reviews.author: kms0904

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed with this welding helmet.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this welding helmet. It works really well. It’s amazing to think that just a few years ago a helmet like this would have cost 2-3x as much. I really like the external shade adjustment. That makes it very easy to switch between grinding and welding without having to get your hands inside the mask. It also comes with about 6 replacement lens covers as well, so that’s nice.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised (for welding).
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to - turn on at the right time, off at the right time. My eyes feel as safe as they did with my old plain helmet, but now I can actually see where my wire is when I start. I would have bought one of these years ago but they hadn't gotten this cheap until more recently.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene G.

customer_reviews.title: The auto darkening feature seems to work fine. The helmet is very lightweight and is just ...
customer_reviews.text: It can be challenging to find the exact size shield as you should always have spares in order to maintain a clear and unobstructed view of your projects. The reality is that there is no standard so each helmet manufacturer has their own size suitable for their product (as they see it). The auto darkening feature seems to work fine. The helmet is very lightweight and is just right for home projects. I also purchased magnifier lens as I am far sighted.
customer_reviews.author: R. DONG

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first use of an auto darkening helmet for welding. I chose it because it reviewed well and was relatively inexpensive. It worked very well. The screen darkened the instant the arc was struck; the time it remains dark after the arc stops it adjustable, as it the "darkness" of the screen. The headband is adjustable both for diameter, and distance over the top of the head. You'll need to take a few minutes to adjust the down position with the fixed positions on the pivot points on the left and right sides.
customer_reviews.author: David R Dozier

customer_reviews.title: Simple and dependable welding hood.
customer_reviews.text: This hood is easy to set, has variable controls for darkness, and even has a grinding setting. I won't go back to standard hoods again. There isn't a delay on darkening, either, so I haven't had any issues with flash burns using it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Auto darken doesn’t always work
customer_reviews.text: I have had this helmet a few years now. I am a hobbyist so it is t used very often. But the last two times I have tried to use it, it seems to work if I’m outside and the sun (no not looking at the sun) will cause it to auto darken. But if I try to weld, it will not auto Darken. So, it’s good. But not great.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson Guy

customer_reviews.title: a Nice Welding Helmet
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice helmet , great for the money, like the features and easy to use , better then most I have seen in stores, very well satisfied with this product, dont use it alot but seems a very good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Warren David

customer_reviews.title: Good for hobby welders but not great for professional use.
customer_reviews.text: Decent helmets for the price, definitely recommended for hobby welders. If you weld for a living definitely invest in a better helmet. It fits well, comes with a comfortable headband and has replacement lens covers. My complaints with this helmet is that it feels a bit flimsy and the shade selector has no detent preventing it from changing the setting if bumped or when you flick the helmet closed. Luckily the latter problem only moves it to a darker shade than selected but it gets annoying really fast.
customer_reviews.author: ACAM47

customer_reviews.title: Save your eyes, and money go Miller or Lincoln
customer_reviews.text: Awful helmet. Auto dark is unreliable at best. The first day, the clear lens on the front came free on a long weld, and of course the spatter hit the main lens. Helmet didn't even last 4 hours in the shop, before it completely gave out on me. Save your time and money, and get a better, more reliable helmet.
customer_reviews.author: ManiaTaxidion

customer_reviews.title: Great shield at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using for a little over a week straight and have been very impressed with the functionality of the shield. Auto darkening works as it should. The mask is a little flimsy hence why I gave it 4 stars. It also dosent like to stay up when you flip it up. You have to keep adjusting the side knobs. It's really not a hassle. Overall I'm happy and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Haskett

customer_reviews.title: FLASHED... And not in a good way, ya know what I'm sayin'
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it, it flashed me twice. Tried it again just to see and was flashed again... It's not a fun experience and I like my retinas, they've been pretty good to me and I'd like to return the favor, therefore I'm returning this helmet.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Good value I think.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty surprised with this unit! So far it has been very nice. Works like advertised. It is light and comfortable. The sensitivity seems excellent. For the money this is working well for me. I have never worn one of the 400 dollar units so perhaps this review isn't worth it's salt but heck, I'm pleased. I don't think it would fair well in an industrial abusive climate as it is thin and light to hold but that wasn't what I was looking for. If you are a hobby welder I don't see why you wouldn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience TWICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a welding student through our local college and we have purchased this helmet TWICE now to have it fail in less than 6 months each time. His instructor at the college says this is a very cheap product and encouraged us to purchase a higher quality helmet next time around. I can't find any contact info to report this to the manufacturer however I'm disappointed to have this product fail twice, each time only lasting 6 months or less. He is a student with classes twice a week, so the helmet was not being used very often, and still only lasted minimal time. Buyer's beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: MOM

customer_reviews.title: Not sure that I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: This helmet initially looked like it was going to work good. I put it back in the box and didn't get to use it for about a week. By the time I got to using it the batteries were dead and I had to spend five bucks for new batteries. It wouldn't charge with the solar. Once I replace the batteries it seemed to work fine but not holding my breath how long it will last
customer_reviews.author: Review123

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 7 year old auto helmet was kinda beat and acting inconsistently. I was amazed at how much better these sensitivity and setting controls are. I also bought a 2.0 cheater lens because my 50 year old eyes are weakening and wow did that make a world of difference. I can see the pool of metal again! I just wish there was a way to integrate a simple cartridge filter into these helmets. Love it though.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: After reading mixed reviews, i still decided to buy it. Seems like you might get a dud or your might not. I have gotten a good one so far, i used it right of box and worked as expected. Much much better then a non auto darkening helmet. For the price if it breaks in a year or two i would probably buy another
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Antra welding helmet
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet, I was told. I purchased it as a gift for my father and he loves it. Helmet works as intended with no issues. Couldn't beat the price, however all the positive reviews are what led me to purchase this item and I was not let down. Are you thinking whether you should buy this welding helmet? Don't think, just click buy. Trust me, you won't regret it!! Fast shipping to! 😃
customer_reviews.author: bdavii

customer_reviews.title: Fasntastic!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with "Hobby" arc welding (120 Amps, small jobs). It works faultlessly. The only criticism is that the hood is a bit small, and there is flash that gets underneath it. If I was doing it all day I would be worried, but for hobby stuff it is perfect - So much better than the old masks where you cant see anything
customer_reviews.author: kim DiDonato-Murrell

customer_reviews.title: tape the knob or check it EVERY time you strike an arc, and don’t you have more important things
customer_reviews.text: The shade control is a big knob that is easily bumped and needs improvement. It flashed me multiple times before I had to tape it in position. It should have detents or be much stiffer. I am welding it tight quarters right now. The visibility is fantastic. The holding it up position not very strong despite cranking the knobs tight needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for beginner to start with , the auto darkening did stop working after 1 hour of usage . But I remove the battery and reinstall it. It started to work again. Again it's cheap enough for beginner to use . It's not that comfort but for the money. It's not bad
customer_reviews.author: EDDIE C

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere I have an auto-darkening helmet, but I couldn't find it. So I ordered this one and I didn't want to spend a lot of money on one but wanted a good one. This one got good reviews and rightly so. Lightweight and easily darkens.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: Great welding helmet
customer_reviews.text: Get the job done perfectly and at an amazing price. Battery lasts a long time and was easy to replace. It’s not pretty but who wants to pay an extra $100 for flame designs when this gets it done the same way!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. alot less expensive than others. HOWEVER, alot of light shines in from the back. this is bad when the arc flash is reflected onto your screen and you see it. But all hoods shaped like this will have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love this helmet
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried many helmets. I am a beginner welder and have only used one or two others that were old. So this helmet did not have much to compete with. But it blows away my expectations. It includes, well i don't even know how many, probably 5 front plastic shields. Has a button to test and makes sure it works. And works great no matter what you are welding in whatever enironment you are in. I adjust depending on the piece I am working on and I don't even think about if it works or not, it just does.
customer_reviews.author: 157collective

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best for the price. Lost or had the first one stolen so I bought another. Only complaint I have is when walking under or through welding curtains the dimming knob tends to get rotated, it doesn't have any detent which honestly I wouldn't expect but just something that needs to be monitored so you don't start welding and can't see because it's set to max darkness, luckily I never had it rotate the other way to be light. Kinda wish I had gotten a larger viewing window but I'm a hobbyist taking a class not a real welder
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece for your safety.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing helmet for welding jobs. Adjustable sensitivity to lights and fast reaction, i love that you could adjust the darkness of the screen and delay switching off the screen darkness when welding lights is off. Wonderful piece to have for your eyes safely so durable comfortable and well made materials.
customer_reviews.author: FAHAD E. B. AL-BARHOMI

customer_reviews.title: Honest Review
customer_reviews.text: Can't give this product a true rating yet. Received it on time. Everything was there. Simple instructions. Tinkered with it a bit using the bedroom light. When turned on any welding setting 9/5-13/9 it dims when you turn the helmet toward direct light. Im sure it will work the same when I get to weld. Will do a follow-up review.
customer_reviews.author: Jurrarriboi84

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for worker wearing glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps expensive as beginner helmet, but much better vision than 25 dollar auto darkening helmet. Another plus is that it takes magnifying lenses nicely, and for people like me who cannot write or weld without glasses, this helmet is a great fit. I wear +2.5 glasses under this helmet and install 2.5X magnifying lens on it - now I can see the puddle. Another plus is a test button, love it.
customer_reviews.author: SERGEI RUSAKOV

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Helmet
customer_reviews.text: I love this helmet. I'm a novice welder but am making better rolls and less holes. My first helmet was the flip type which I'd learned to deal with and the wife noticed that I'd been looking at this one so it is my Valentine's Day gift. First use was today and I was amazed that it acts so quickly. Many helmets cost 300.00 bucks or more and I'm sure they are worth it but if you are using a flip type this is well worth the money. I've ordered a magnifying lens to go with it, it takes a 2 inch by 4.25 inch and has the retainer built into the helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good value beginners’ Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a beginner welder. It responds reliably and well. The instructions were not clear for me but I read between the lines and experimented. I tried looking at the sun as the final test. You could make out sunspots so I now fully trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Eckersley

customer_reviews.title: Great Welding Helmet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good welding helmet for everyday use. I was surprised at how well it worked as you can adjust welding brightness to suit your needs. I am not a professional welder and only use a small MIG welder but this gets the job done for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: ... does its job and for its price its a good choice. However
customer_reviews.text: The helmet does its job and for its price its a good choice. However, the helmet will fall down easily which is very frustrating and the viewing window is pretty dang small. Seriously, you have to avoid looking down with the helmet flipped up and when your positioning your work its nearly impossible. If you get annoyed easily like me, just avoid this helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto F.

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS PERFECTLY, THE WAY IT SHOUL BE
customer_reviews.text: I GOT MY NEW HELMET, I TRY IT YESTERDAY THER IS ONLY ONE WORD TO DESCRIBE IT PERFORMANCE..."PERFECT" I AM AN AMATEUR WELDER, AND FOR ME THE MOST DIFFICULT PART OF WELDING WAS THE LIGHT... WELL NO MORE PROBLEM WITH MY BRAND NEW HELMET IT WORKS LIKE A CHARM
customer_reviews.author: TITO TRIMARCHI

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like is the adjustable sensitivity, darkness settings, and delay (for turning off filter). View screen plenty large, excellent quality, and prompt delivery. I bought it for my 15 yr old son, who’s getting into welding/metal working. He thought it was so cool he spent the next few hours walking around the house like an infamous movie character.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Throw away shield!  No replacement splatter plates!
customer_reviews.text: No replaceable cover plate splatter guard for the lenses ... after the splatter builds up you cannot see out of it have to throw it away. All good shields have replacement cover plates to protect the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Diyguy

customer_reviews.title: Value!
customer_reviews.text: This welding helmet is a great value! I have had it for a couple years now and it has performed well. I had to change the batteries in it last year but that was an easy job.
customer_reviews.author: Buckhunter88

customer_reviews.title: (Updated) Stopped working correctly
customer_reviews.text: At first I really enjoyed this helmet as I thought it worked for quite well for the price. But I had the similar experience as another reviewer in which after over a year of use it stopped auto darkening quickly (sometimes takes seconds) or would lighten mid-weld causing me to get flashed. Unfortunately it looks like I'll have to replace this helmet with something different as I don't want my eyes to get injured anymore by these repetitive flashes due to the helmet not auto darkening as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Jared S.

customer_reviews.title: This thing should be more money, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was leary about buying this welding helmet just cause it was cheap. But I've been pleasantly surprised with it. It works great, I like the adjuster on the outside of helmet on a dial. Works really good, sent alot of replacement screens to. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Rawwalk

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: After using the welding helmet for a month, I'm very pleased with its darkening, sensitivity and comfort. The only issue is the ease that the darkening adjustment knob moves. With the knob mounted where you handle the helmet, you tend to bump it by mistake and change the darkening setting. You don't realize it until you strike an ark. Either move the knob or make the knob harder to turn to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Polons

customer_reviews.title: Nice Helmet - BUT Battery Replacement and Instructions are HORRIBLE ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice Helmet - BUT Battery Replacement and Instructions are HORRIBLE I like the helmet, but the instructions and process of replacing batteries are ABSURD. Instructions simply say "Carefully open battery compartments." What they fail to say is that the compartment is inaccessible until after you remove the from bezel, AND the cartridge assembly - both of which are a bit of a pain because the tabs that are supposed to simplify removal don't help at all!! Otherwise a nice helmet.
customer_reviews.author: BobH

customer_reviews.title: I CAN SEE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved the helmet that I have decided to write a review. I am just a hobbyist and this helmet has made my job way, way easier. I used to own the cheap one shade helmet from lowes, but found it near impossible to properly see before I would start my welding. This product has changed the way I see (literally) my projects and actually enjoy the welding experience. I would highly recommend this helmet for someone that is just starting out and trying out welding for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: JoseCiriaco

customer_reviews.title: new batteries and still doesnt get dark enough!
customer_reviews.text: This helmet is light and cheap, but that doesnt amtter if the helmet doesnt get dark enough to protect your eyes! After trying a new battery it is the same... the settings work but just doesnt get dark enough. Burnt eye balls are the result.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The right price for a good tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a $300 helmet. It gets five stars because of the price tag. It’s very comfortable, fast and adjustable. The batteries are accessible unlike the harbor freight model that has a similar price. It has much nicer fit and finish then my H/F helmet. A lot of helmet for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional welder, but I found this one very good and work as it should be. My welding spot is now close to perfect, I am now hitting the right spot unlike my old not auto dark. Also very useful when grinding to protect your whole face from sparks.
customer_reviews.author: MauiBoy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth even the los price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using for several months. It blocks light but cannot see puddle. Huge difference when compared with a higher quality helmet in terms of being able to see what you are doing. Flashes with flux core MIG. Best to spend the money and get a higher quality device. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ed livingston

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for anything more! Especially at this price!
customer_reviews.text: This welding helmet works great! I really couldn't be happier with the value of it. It dims quickly on spark, and visibility during welding was great. It also came with some extra lens protectors. I basically pulled it out of the box and started welding. I would certainly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: BColumbian

customer_reviews.title: Nice helmet.
customer_reviews.text: After two year purchased this helmet is working fine, no need to replace the battery. I appreciate the replacement front protective cover included in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Suazo M.

customer_reviews.title: A great value for novice or hobbyist welders
customer_reviews.text: Very nice helmet. Pick the right setting and you have no trouble seeing your weld bead as you go. An excellent value for beginners or hobbyists who aren't looking for a professional-grade product.
customer_reviews.author: JonnyCrash

customer_reviews.title: Really nice looking
customer_reviews.text: So far so good the helmet looks beautiful came with 6 extra front lens 1 inside lens and 2 spare battery's great price. I modified my helmet with a couple spikes gave it some attitude.
customer_reviews.author: Notto

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had any issues with the quality or performance and I'd high recommend this for others
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a lot of welding and I'm not an expert but this helmet really helped my occasional welding work on car and garage projects. I was previously using a fixed shade helmet and had a lot of issues with setting up for tight area tacks. The autodimming helps to be able to see the setup before you start welding and I've never had issue with it not-darkening while welding. I haven't had any issues with the quality or performance and I'd high recommend this for others.
customer_reviews.author: CollinTop Contributor: Photography
